required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Point-of-care Ultrasound in Prehospital Dyspnea: Game-changer or Gaming-gadgets?

brief_summary.textblock: Point-of-care ultrasound in patients with dyspnoea has been shown to alter patient treatment and the time to correct treatment when performed in emergency departments. In Denmark, physician-staffed ambulances are sent to citizens with severe ABCD symptoms including dyspnoea. Hence, there is a potential for correct diagnostics and appropriate treatment already in the citizens' own home or en route to the hospital. This study aims to evaluate the clinical performance of prehospital point-of-care ultrasound in patients with dyspnoea.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From initial citizen contact to end of ultrasound examination within 15 minutes
primary_outcome.description: Change in sensitivity for diagnosing heart failure when adding point-of-care ultrasound to the clinical examination

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initial citizen contact and within a time-span of 15 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity of clinical examination for for diagnosing heart failure. Held up against a post-hoc expert panel statement.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initial citizen contact and within a time-span of 15 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity of clinical examination supplemented with ultrasound scan for diagnosing heart failure. Held up against a post-hoc expert panel statement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment changes in medicine caused by ultrasound examination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initial citizen contact and within a time-span of 15 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in medical treatment including diuretics, nitric oxide, bronkodilation and steroids caused by the addition of an ultrasound scan

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment changes in ventilation caused by ultrasound examination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initial citizen contact and within a time-span of 15 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment changes ventilatory strategy including nasal cannula oxygen therapi, face mask or non-invasive positive pressure ventilation caused by the addition of an ultrasound scan

secondary_outcome.measure: Triage changes caused by ultrasound examination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initial citizen contact and within a time-span of 60 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the department or hospital that the patient is sent to as a cause of an ultrasound scan

intervention.description: Focused ultrasound of the heart, lungs and pleurae

study_pop.textblock: All citizens who have contacted the Acute Medical Coordination center in the Central Denmark Region for emergency medical treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age >/= 18 years
- dyspnea as a dominating complaint At least one of
- respiratory frequency >25/minute
- oxygen saturation < 95%
- oxygen therapy initiated
Exclusion Criteria:
- trama patients
- prior enrollment
